lines.text: I don't believe I'll need bodyguards.
You'll need 'em, alright.
You think we no good, eh?
No, it's not that...
We've had a lot of experience, Captain. We bodyguarded the last two troubleshooters right up to the very minute they was killed.
That Jeff Butler doesn't have all his brains in his holster.

[informing Mollie that her husband Dick Allen is dead]
He'll be waiting for us ... at end of track.
I look around and pretty soon I marry my wife in Santa Fe. Ah, the best woodchopper in the country. You bet you my life, the best. But one day she gets bite by a rattlesnake.
She did? Did the doctor get there in time?
No, she's already dead.
Your wife?
My wife? No, no, the snake.
What's a dead Indian, more or less? The Army's been killing them for years.
The Army doesn't kill Indians for fun, Campeau. And I don't think you do, either.

Did you never know that flirting gets into a woman's blood like fighting gets into a man's? Now, a girl begins coquetting to discover if she has the power. Then she goes looking, like a fighter after a bully, for the hardest man to conquer. But 'tis never the man she wants, 'tis the pleasure of bringing him to her feet.
Till the right man comes along and gives her the spanking she deserves.
Ah, that's the man she dreams of.
Don't reach for your handkerchief, Brett. Just use your sleeve if you want to wipe your mouth.
Now you boys has got your options of getting out in 30 seconds or being buried in 30 minutes.
You're all aces, bucko. But you're in love with Mollie and don't you ever forget she's my wife.
I might. She wouldn't.
There's nothing like hearing an engine whistle in the still night.
